alert.note: Alert for Bering Strait Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Lower Yukon River; Northern Seward Peninsula; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 4:31AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow, Blowing Snow, and Cold Wind Chills This Weekend... Cold arctic air will move south from the NW Arctic over the West Coast this weekend. Strong north winds gusting as high as 40 mph will accompany the cold air Saturday night and Sunday, which will bring areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility along with wind chills as cold as -40 F. Accumulating snowfall is also expected with general snowfall accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, and the heaviest snowfall over the Lower Yukon Valley, where 4 to 8 inches are possible from late Friday night through Sunday. The snow, blowing snow, and cold wind chills will make for very difficult travel conditions over the holiday weekend. This forecast is still evolving and will be updated as necessary, so stay tuned for further updates.
